input.description: Text input to the model, used to generate a response.

oneOf.description: A text input to the model, equivalent to a text input with the `user` role.
oneOf.title: Text input

oneOf.description: A list of one or many input items to the model, containing different content types.
A message input to the model with a role indicating instruction following hierarchy.
A text input to the model.
oneOf.title: Text input

oneOf.description: An array of content parts.
A text input to the model.

text.description: The text input to the model.

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_text`.

oneOf.title: Input text
Content array

role.description: The role of the message input. One of `user`, `assistant`, `system`, or `developer`.

oneOf.title: Easy input message

oneOf.description: A message input to the model with explicit type field.

content.description: A list of one or many input content items.

oneOf.description: A text input to the model.

text.description: The text input to the model.

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_text`.

oneOf.title: Input text

role.description: The role of the message input. One of `user`, `system`, or `developer`. Note: assistant role is not supported with explicit type.

status.description: The status of item. Populated when items are returned via API.

type.description: The type of the message input. Always set to `message`.

oneOf.title: Input message

oneOf.description: An internal identifier for an item to reference.

id.description: The ID of the item to reference.

type.description: The type of item to reference. Always `item_reference`.

oneOf.title: Item reference

oneOf.description: A function call generated by the model.

arguments.description: A JSON string of the arguments to pass to the function.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call generated by the model.

id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

type.description: The type of the function call. Always `function_call`.

oneOf.title: Function call

oneOf.description: The output of a function tool call.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call generated by the model.

id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call output.

output.description: A JSON string of the output of the function tool call.

type.description: The type of the function tool call output. Always `function_call_output`.

oneOf.title: Function call output
Input item list

instructions.description: Inserts a system (or developer) message as the first item in the model's context.

max_output_tokens.description: An upper bound for the number of tokens that can be generated for a response, including visible output tokens and reasoning tokens.

metadata.description: Custom key-value pairs for storing additional information. Maximum of 16 pairs.

model.description: ID of the model to use. For details on which models are compatible with the Responses API, see available [models](https://console.groq.com/docs/models)

parallel_tool_calls.description: Enable parallel execution of multiple tool calls.

reasoning.description: Configuration for reasoning capabilities when using [models that support reasoning](https://console.groq.com/docs/reasoning).

effort.description: Level of reasoning effort. Supported values: `low`, `medium`, `high`. Lower values provide faster responses with less reasoning depth.

service_tier.description: Specifies the latency tier to use for processing the request.

store.description: Response storage flag. Note: Currently only supports false or null values.

stream.description: Enable streaming mode to receive response data as server-sent events.

temperature.description: Controls randomness in the response generation. Range: 0 to 2. Lower values produce more deterministic outputs, higher values increase variety and creativity.

text.description: Response format configuration. Supports plain text or structured JSON output.

format.description: An object specifying the format that the model must output.

oneOf.description: Default response format. Used to generate text responses.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always `text`.

oneOf.title: Text

oneOf.description: JSON object response format. An older method of generating JSON responses. Using `json_schema` is recommended for models that support it. Note that the model will not generate JSON without a system or user message instructing it to do so.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always `json_object`.

oneOf.title: JSON object

oneOf.description: JSON Schema response format. Used to generate structured JSON responses.

description.description: A description of what the response format is for, used by the model to determine how to respond in the format.

name.description: The name of the response format. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

schema.description: The schema for the response format, described as a JSON Schema object.

strict.description: Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the output.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always `json_schema`.

oneOf.title: JSON schema

tool_choice.description:
Controls which (if any) tool is called by the model.
`none` means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message.
`auto` means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or more tools.
`required` means the model must call one or more tools.
Specifying a particular tool via `{"type": "function", "function": {"name": "my_function"}}` forces the model to call that tool.

`none` is the default when no tools are present. `auto` is the default if tools are present.

oneOf.description: `none` means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message. `auto` means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or more tools. `required` means the model must call one or more tools.
Specifies a tool the model should use. Use to force the model to call a specific function.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

type.description: The type of the tool. Currently, only `function` is supported.

tools.description: List of tools available to the model. Currently supports function definitions only. Maximum of 128 functions.

description.description: Describes the function's purpose. The model uses this to determine when to invoke the function.

name.description: The name of the function to be called. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

parameters.description: Function parameters defined as a JSON Schema object. Refer to https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/ for schema documentation.

strict.description: Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the function call.

type.description: The type of the tool. Currently, only `function` is supported.

top_p.description: Nucleus sampling parameter that controls the cumulative probability cutoff. Range: 0 to 1. A value of 0.1 restricts sampling to tokens within the top 10% probability mass.

truncation.description: Context truncation strategy. Supported values: `auto` or `disabled`.

user.description: Optional identifier for tracking end-user requests. Useful for usage monitoring and compliance.

schema.description: Represents a response returned by model, based on the provided input.

background.description: Whether the response was generated in the background.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the response was created.

error.description: An error object if the response failed.

id.description: A unique identifier for the response.

incomplete_details.description: Details about why the response is incomplete.

reason.description: The reason why the response is incomplete.

instructions.description: The system instructions used for the response.

max_output_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens configured for the response.

max_tool_calls.description: The maximum number of tool calls allowed.

model.description: The model used for the response.

object.description: The object type, which is always `response`.

output.description: An array of content items generated by the model.

oneOf.description: An output message from the model.

content.description: The content of the output message.

oneOf.description: A text output from the model.

annotations.description: The annotations of the text output.

oneOf.description: A citation to a file.

index.description: The index of the citation in the text.

type.description: The type of the annotation. Always `file_citation`.

oneOf.title: File citation

oneOf.description: A citation for a web resource.

end_index.description: The index of the last character of the URL citation in the message.

start_index.description: The index of the first character of the URL citation in the message.

title.description: The title of the web resource.

type.description: The type of the annotation. Always `url_citation`.

url.description: The URL of the web resource.

oneOf.title: URL citation

logprobs.description: Log probability information for the output.

text.description: The text output from the model.

type.description: The type of the output text. Always `output_text`.

oneOf.title: Output text

id.description: The unique ID of the output message.

role.description: The role of the output message. Always `assistant`.

type.description: The type of the output message. Always `message`.

oneOf.title: Output message

oneOf.description: A function call generated by the model.

arguments.description: A JSON string of the arguments to pass to the function.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call generated by the model.

id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

status.description: The status of the function call.

type.description: The type of the function call. Always `function_call`.

oneOf.title: Function call

oneOf.description: A reasoning output from the model. Available for [models that support reasoning](https://console.groq.com/docs/reasoning).

id.description: The unique ID of the reasoning output.

type.description: The type of the reasoning output. Always `reasoning`.

oneOf.title: Reasoning

parallel_tool_calls.description: Whether the model can run tool calls in parallel.

service_tier.description: The service tier used for processing.

status.description: The status of the response generation. One of `completed`, `failed`, `in_progress`, or `incomplete`.

text.description: Text format configuration used for the response.

format.description: An object specifying the format that the model must output.

oneOf.description: Default response format. Used to generate text responses.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always `text`.

oneOf.title: Text

oneOf.description: JSON object response format. An older method of generating JSON responses. Using `json_schema` is recommended for models that support it. Note that the model will not generate JSON without a system or user message instructing it to do so.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always `json_object`.

oneOf.title: JSON object

oneOf.description: JSON Schema response format. Used to generate structured JSON responses.

description.description: A description of what the response format is for, used by the model to determine how to respond in the format.

name.description: The name of the response format. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

schema.description: The schema for the response format, described as a JSON Schema object.

strict.description: Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the output.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always `json_schema`.

oneOf.title: JSON schema

tool_choice.description:
Controls which (if any) tool is called by the model.
`none` means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message.
`auto` means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or more tools.
`required` means the model must call one or more tools.
Specifying a particular tool via `{"type": "function", "function": {"name": "my_function"}}` forces the model to call that tool.

`none` is the default when no tools are present. `auto` is the default if tools are present.

oneOf.description: `none` means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message. `auto` means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or more tools. `required` means the model must call one or more tools.
Specifies a tool the model should use. Use to force the model to call a specific function.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

type.description: The type of the tool. Currently, only `function` is supported.

tools.description: The tools that were available to the model.

description.description: Describes the function's purpose. The model uses this to determine when to invoke the function.

name.description: The name of the function to be called. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

parameters.description: Function parameters defined as a JSON Schema object. Refer to https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/ for schema documentation.

strict.description: Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the function call.

type.description: The type of the tool. Currently, only `function` is supported.

top_logprobs.description: The number of top log probabilities returned.

usage.description: Usage statistics for the response request.

input_tokens.description: Number of tokens in the input.

output_tokens.description: Number of tokens in the generated output.

total_tokens.description: Total number of tokens used in the request (input + output).

summary: Creates a model response for the given input.
